There exist monitors/defibrillators allow measurement real time feedback quality chest compression ventilation . In addition give prehospital provider benefit real time CPR quality feedback via voice visual cue , CPR quality data acquire use device utilized part on-going quality assurance/quality improvement program . A second objective project determine whether use audiovisual feedback improve CPR quality patient outcome pre-hospital setting .
DOC.brief_title: Arizona Prehospital CPR Quality Improvement Project
DOC.detailed_description: Phase I : In first phase project , EMS system utilize E-series unit treat patient OHCA . The audiovisual feedback prompt inactivated phase . The EMS provider instruct follow standard CCR protocol , currently practice . Aside change monitor/defibrillator equipment , treatment OHCA patient phase identical treatment currently perform . The quality CPR measure use accelerometer-based system . The data store defibrillator download upon completion call . The first phase conduct approximately 6 month time site initiate use E-series monitor/defibrillators . Phase 2 : In second phase project , EMS provider undergo train use audiovisual feedback prompt . The provider continue treat patient accord CCR protocol receive audio and/or visual feedback quality CPR performing . The provider select prefer feedback method ( ) - audio , visual . As phase I , CPR data store defibrillator download upon completion call . The total number EMS personnel train approximately 450 . In Phase I , 219 OHCAs ( 80 % Mesa Fire Dept , 20 % Guardian Medical Transport ) . So far Phase II , 100 OHCAs .
